output_questions.question:
What will be the output of the following HTML? ```html Test

Hello World!

```
output_questions.output: The browser will display: Hello World!
output_questions.explanation:
This is a basic HTML structure. The `

` tag outputs 'Hello World!' on the web page.

output_questions.question:
What is displayed by this code in a browser? ```html

My First Heading

My first paragraph.

```
output_questions.output: A large heading 'My First Heading' and below it the text 'My first paragraph.'
output_questions.explanation:
The `

` tag displays a large heading. The `

` tag displays a paragraph below the heading.

output_questions.question:
What will appear when you open this HTML file? ```html

This is a test.
This is on a new line.

```
output_questions.output:
This is a test.
This is on a new line.
output_questions.explanation:
The `
` tag causes a line break, so the second sentence appears on a new line.

output_questions.question:
What will be rendered by this HTML snippet? ```html

Bold and Italic

```
output_questions.output: Bold and Italic (with 'Bold' in bold and 'Italic' in italics)
output_questions.explanation: `<b>` makes text bold and `<i>` makes text italic within the paragraph.

output_questions.question:
What does this code show in the browser? ```html

HelloWorld

```
output_questions.explanation: HTML comments (`<!-- ... -->`) are not displayed in the browser.

output_questions.question:
What will the browser display? ```html

2 < 3 and 5 > 4

```
output_questions.explanation: `<` and `>` are HTML entities for '<' and '>'. They are shown as symbols in the browser.

output_questions.question:
What happens when this HTML is rendered? ```html

First line Second line

```
output_questions.explanation: Line breaks in HTML source code are ignored in normal flow, so both sentences appear on the same line.

output_questions.question:
What does the following HTML output? ```html
  • Apple
  • Banana
```
output_questions.output: A bulleted list with 'Apple' and 'Banana' as items.
output_questions.explanation: `<ul>` creates an unordered (bulleted) list; `<li>` defines each list item.

output_questions.question:
What will be shown? ```html
  1. One
  2. Two
```
output_questions.explanation: `<ol>` creates an ordered (numbered) list; `<li>` defines each item.

output_questions.question: What does this HTML render? ```html ```
output_questions.output: The image 'logo.png' (or, if not found, the text 'Logo')
output_questions.explanation: The `` tag displays an image. If the image is missing, the 'alt' text is shown instead.

output_questions.question:
What will the following code display? ```html

© 2025

```
output_questions.explanation: `©` is the entity for the copyright symbol.

output_questions.question:
What happens when this code is viewed in the browser? ```html

Space  Space

```
output_questions.explanation: ` ` creates a non-breaking space. So there are two spaces between the words.

output_questions.question:
What does this code display? ```html

This is a heading

This is a paragraph.

```
output_questions.output: A medium-sized heading 'This is a heading' and below it the paragraph 'This is a paragraph.'
output_questions.explanation:
`

` is a medium-sized heading. `

` is a paragraph.

output_questions.question:
What is the output of this HTML? ```html 
Line 1
   Line 2
      Line 3
```
output_questions.explanation: `<pre>` preserves whitespace and line breaks, so the text appears as written.

output_questions.question: What will appear when this HTML is rendered? ```html Click here ```
output_questions.output: A clickable link with the text 'Click here'.
output_questions.explanation: `<a>` creates a hyperlink. The text inside is shown as clickable.

output_questions.question: What is the visible result of the following HTML? ```html Hello! ```
output_questions.explanation: The text 'Hello!' will be both bold and italic.

output_questions.question:
What does this code render? ```html

Heading

Subheading

```
output_questions.output: A large heading 'Heading' and a slightly smaller heading 'Subheading' below it.
output_questions.explanation: `<h1>` is the largest heading, `<h2>` is the second largest.

output_questions.question:
What will you see in the browser? ```html

Visible text

```
output_questions.explanation: Comments are ignored; only 'Visible text' appears.

output_questions.question:
What is displayed for this code? ```html

The price is €50

```
output_questions.explanation: `€` is the HTML entity for the Euro symbol.

output_questions.question:
What is rendered by this snippet? ```html

5 > 2

```
output_questions.explanation: `>` is the HTML entity for the greater-than symbol.
